lead_paragraph: DIAMOND--Robert S.,a New York journalist and business executive, died June 15 in Arizona after a brave, lengthy struggle to overcome complications following heart valve surgery in New York. He was 77 years old. Born in Phoenix, he was the son of Rose G. and Bertrand A. Diamond; and grandson of Nathan Diamond, pioneer merchant, who co-founded one of Arizona's early department stores. Journalism and public affairs were a passion. A graduate of Claremont McKenna College and Columbia's Graduate School of Journalism, he wrote for the Arizona Republic, Los Angeles Times and was one of the youngest staff writers for Fortune Magazine in the 1960's. Throughout his career Mr. Diamond lived in New York with his wife of 52 years, Susan. He was a senior officer of the Dun & Bradstreet Corp (now retired) the majority of his business career. Yet his never-ending pride in his Arizona heritage dominated his desire to return to Arizona as he neared life's end. Mr. Diamond was a member of national and local boards including Reading is Fundamental where he retired as vice chair; the Arizona Community Foundation; and he was a current Trustee of the Heard Museum. Survivors include his wife, Susan; brother-in-law, Larry Arnsberg; niece Lilli and cherished cousins. 1/3
